intro: Rinorea poggei, commonly known as the pink-flowered rinorea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pink or purple flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a velvety texture. Rinorea poggei is typically found in humid, shaded environments such as rainforests.
